descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This seminar introduces the students to a range of art- historical approaches and to the writings of key figures in the history of the discipline. We will address two basic but difficult questions: What is art history? And how did it get this way? Through a series of short writing exercises, we will examine ways of thinking and writing concretely and rigorously about works of art in different mediums, and across different cultures. Intended for undergraduate majors.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Short weekly assignments; one 10-page final paper

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Readings will be posted on the course website.
